results.title: I, Tonya
results.creator_credit: LuckyChap Entertainment, Clubhouse Pictures, Jade Healy, Margot Robbie, Jennifer Johnson, Bryan Unkeless, Tom Ackerley, Steven Rogers, Craig Gillespie, Justin David Burton and Pierina Bustamante
results.brief_description: Competitive ice skater Tonya Harding rises amongst the ranks at the U. S. Figure Skating Championships, but her future in the sport is thrown into doubt when her ex-husband intervenes.

constellations_other.name: No guts, no glory
constellations_other.description: TV arrived just in time for the 1956 Melbourne Olympics. The Olympics crystallise ideas of nationalism, athletic heroism, and controversy, all of which have been explored through countless features, documentaries and TV shows.

results.creator_credit_for_label: LuckyChap Entertainment, Clubhouse Pictures, Jade Healy, Margot Robbie, Jennifer Johnson, Bryan Unkeless, Tom Ackerley, Steven Rogers, Craig Gillespie, Justin David Burton and Pierina Bustamante
results.description: Competitive ice skater Tonya Harding rises amongst the ranks at the U. S. Figure Skating Championships, but her future in the sport is thrown into doubt when her ex-husband intervenes.
description_for_label: Competitive ice skater Tonya Harding rises amongst the ranks at the U. S. Figure Skating Championships, but her future in the sport is thrown into doubt when her ex-husband intervenes.

results.title: I Was a Teenage Werewolf
results.creator_credit: Sunset Productions, American International Pictures, Gene Fowler Jr., A. Leslie Thomas, Herman Cohen and Aben Kandel
results.brief_description: A meat-eating teenager (Michael Landon) sees a psychiatrist (Whit Bissell), who only makes things worse.

constellations_other.name: Horror movie right there on my TV
constellations_other.description: The colourful and quirky music video for Skyhooksâ€™ song 'Horror Movie' helped propel them to number one, making it their biggest hit.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Sunset Productions, American International Pictures, Gene Fowler Jr., A. Leslie Thomas, Herman Cohen and Aben Kandel
results.description: A meat-eating teenager (Michael Landon) sees a psychiatrist (Whit Bissell), who only makes things worse.

results.title: I May Destroy You
results.creator_credit: Lynsey Moore, Paul Cross, Simon Meyers, Simon Maloney, FALKNA Productions and Various Artists Limited
results.brief_description: Set in London, where gratification is only an app away, the story centers on Arabella, a carefree, self-assured Londoner with a group of great friends, a boyfriend in Italy, and a burgeoning writing career. But when her drink is spiked, she must question and rebuild every element of her life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynsey Moore, Paul Cross, Simon Meyers, Simon Maloney, FALKNA Productions and Various Artists Limited
results.description: Set in London, where gratification is only an app away, the story centers on Arabella, a carefree, self-assured Londoner with a group of great friends, a boyfriend in Italy, and a burgeoning writing career. But when her drink is spiked, she must question and rebuild every element of her life.

But when her drink is spiked, she must question and rebuild every element of her life.

results.title: I Love Lucy
results.brief_description: Cuban Bandleader Ricky Ricardo would be happy if his wife Lucy would just be a housewife. Instead she tries to perform at the Tropicana where he works, and make life comically frantic at home.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

constellations_other.name: Kylie to Lucy
constellations_other.description: 'Did It Again' started the conversation about Kylie Minogue being more than just a pop star, it started to cement her status as one of the most important audio and visual artists of her time, but the video had an unlikely inspiration.

constellations_other.name: 1950s television
constellations_other.description: "Good evening ... and welcome to television." Bruce Gyngellâ€™s famous words launched television in Australia in 1956 on Sydneyâ€™s TCN9, with the medium finally arriving in the country towards the later end of the decade.

results.description: Cuban Bandleader Ricky Ricardo would be happy if his wife Lucy would just be a housewife. Instead she tries to perform at the Tropicana where he works, and make life comically frantic at home.

results.title: I Am Not Your Negro
results.creator_credit: Raoul Peck, RTS, Shelter Prod, ARTE, RTBF, Independent Lens and Velvet Film
results.headline_credit: Belgium, France and United States of America, 2017
results.brief_description: Working from the text of James Baldwinâ€™s unfinished final novel, director Raoul Peck creates a meditation on what it means to be Black in the United States.

constellations_other.name: MLK/FBI: blackness In America
constellations_other.description: Award-winning documentarian Sam Pollard looks at J. Edgar Hoover and the FBIâ€™s pursuit of Martin Luther King Jr in the lead-up to his assassination during Americaâ€™s Civil Rights Movement of the sixties.

constellations_other.name: My Hometown: Archives woven into new narrative
constellations_other.description: Offering viewers a snapshot of life on the road for an Australian touring band in the 1960s, 'My Hometown', directed by Sari Braithwaite was developed reimagining archival 8mm footage shot by drummer Leon Isackson.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Raoul Peck, RTS, Shelter Prod, ARTE, RTBF, Independent Lens and Velvet Film
results.headline_credit_for_label: Belgium, France and United States of America, 2017
results.description: Working from the text of James Baldwinâ€™s unfinished final novel, director Raoul Peck creates a meditation on what it means to be Black in the United States.

results.title: I Am Mother
results.brief_description: A teenage girl is raised underground by a robot “Mother”, designed to repopulate the earth following an extinction event. But their unique bond is threatened when an inexplicable stranger arrives with alarming news.
results.description: A teenage girl is raised underground by a robot “Mother”, designed to repopulate the earth following an extinction event. But their unique bond is threatened when an inexplicable stranger arrives with alarming news.
description_for_label: A teenage girl is raised underground by a robot “Mother”, designed to repopulate the earth following an extinction event. But their unique bond is threatened when an inexplicable stranger arrives with alarming news.

results.title: I'm Not There.
results.brief_description: Six actors portray six personas of music legend Bob Dylan in scenes depicting various stages of his life, chronicling his rise from unknown folksinger to international icon and revealing how Dylan constantly reinvented himself.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Making films in black and white
constellations_other.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

results.description: Six actors portray six personas of music legend Bob Dylan in scenes depicting various stages of his life, chronicling his rise from unknown folksinger to international icon and revealing how Dylan constantly reinvented himself.

creators_other.name: Film & Entertainment VIP Medienfonds 4 GmbH & Co. KG (I)

results.title: I'll Be Gone in the Dark
results.creator_credit: Kate Barry, Amber Unkle, Susan Alegria, Elizabeth Wolff, Story Syndicate and HBO Documentary Films
results.brief_description: An exploration of the case of the Golden State Killer who terrorized California in the 1970s and 1980s, committing 50 sexual assaults and 10 murders, and true crime author Michelle McNamara’s obsessive quest to find justice on behalf of his victims.

constellations_other.name: Reasonable doubt
constellations_other.description: Factual media has the power to reframe information and put forth new, persuasive arguments.  For the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, True Crime media has the ability to create doubt, right the wrongs of the justice system, and shed new light on closed cases.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan Whiteâ€™s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Koreaâ€™s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Kate Barry, Amber Unkle, Susan Alegria, Elizabeth Wolff, Story Syndicate and HBO Documentary Films
results.description: An exploration of the case of the Golden State Killer who terrorized California in the 1970s and 1980s, committing 50 sexual assaults and 10 murders, and true crime author Michelle McNamara’s obsessive quest to find justice on behalf of his victims.

results.title: HyperNormalisation
results.creator_credit: BBC, Adam Curtis and Sandra Gorel
results.brief_description: HyperNormalisation is a 2016 BBC documentary by British filmmaker Adam Curtis. It argues that governments, financiers, and technological utopians have, since the 1970s, given up on the complex “real world” and built a simpler “fake world” run by corporations and kept stable by politicians.

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image â€“ archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media â€“ to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

results.description: HyperNormalisation is a 2016 BBC documentary by British filmmaker Adam Curtis. It argues that governments, financiers, and technological utopians have, since the 1970s, given up on the complex “real world” and built a simpler “fake world” run by corporations and kept stable by politicians.
description_for_label: HyperNormalisation is a 2016 BBC documentary by British filmmaker Adam Curtis. It argues that governments, financiers, and technological utopians have, since the 1970s, given up on the complex “real world” and built a simpler “fake world” run by corporations and kept stable by politicians.

results.title: Hustlers
results.brief_description: A crew of savvy former strip club employees band together to turn the tables on their Wall Street clients.

constellations_other.name: Crime doesn't pay
constellations_other.description: Ned Kelly's famous armour has appeared in many films, but the criminal myth speaks to how audiences have always been captivated by true-crime stories, from the beginning of cinema to today.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

constellations_other.name: Aquaman VFX
constellations_other.description: As well as becoming a global box-office sensation, Aquaman (2018) featured groundbreaking visual effects from Australian companies such as Method Studios.

results.description: A crew of savvy former strip club employees band together to turn the tables on their Wall Street clients.
